systems.tagline: The customer is always human
systems.description: Zendesk is a cloud-based customer service platform that empowers organizations to deliver exceptional support across multiple channels. It combines AI-powered automation with human expertise to help businesses resolve customer issues faster, improve agent productivity, and build lasting customer relationships through integrated ticketing, messaging, live chat, and knowledge management tools.

statistics.customer_count: Approximately 173,426 paid customer accounts; ~182,000 customers globally; 20,000 customers using Zendesk AI by year-end 2025

features.name: AI-Powered Ticketing System
features.description: Intelligent ticket management with automated routing, prioritization, and resolution tracking across email, chat, social media, and voice channels, powered by machine learning to handle routine requests and suggest solutions.

features.name: Multi-Channel Support
features.description: Unified communication platform enabling customers to reach support through email, live chat, messaging, social media (Facebook, X), voice, and mobile apps, with all conversations consolidated into a single ticket system.

features.name: Zendesk AI Copilot & AI Agents
features.description: Advanced AI assistants that provide real-time guidance to human agents and autonomous AI agents that handle routine customer inquiries, reducing response times by up to 32% and handling 50%+ of email interactions automatically.

features.name: Knowledge Base & Self-Service
features.description: AI-powered help center with generative search, automated knowledge base generation from past tickets, and self-service portal that reduces ticket volume by enabling customers to find answers independently.

features.name: Advanced Analytics & Reporting (Zendesk Explore)
features.description: Real-time dashboards and customizable reports tracking agent performance, customer satisfaction (CSAT), ticket resolution times, SLA compliance, and operational metrics for data-driven decision making.

features.name: Automations & Workflow Builder
features.description: No-code automation engine (Action Builder) enabling custom workflows with triggers and actions, reducing manual tasks and automating responses, ticket routing, and integrations with third-party systems.

features.name: Workforce Engagement Management
features.description: Tools for agent scheduling, performance tracking, quality assurance with custom QA criteria, real-time monitoring of service operations, and back office time tracking for optimized team management.

unique_selling_points: AI-First Resolution Platform: Purpose-built for AI-powered automation with advanced AI Agents that handle complex issues autonomously, backed by 5 billion annual resolutions - the largest operational base for AI training in service.

Omnichannel Excellence: Unified ticketing across email, chat, messaging, voice, and social media in a single intuitive interface, enabling seamless customer experiences regardless of communication channel.

Enterprise-Grade Scalability: Proven ability to scale from startups to Global 500 enterprises with mid-market pricing, supporting millions of interactions daily while maintaining performance and reliability.
Developer-Friendly Ecosystem: Comprehensive API, 1500+ pre-built integrations, and powerful no-code tools (Action Builder, App Builder) enabling rapid customization without engineering overhead.

Human-Centric AI Philosophy: Designed to augment rather than replace human agents, with Copilots providing real-time guidance and intelligent suggestions that enhance agent productivity and decision-making.

The product officially became known as LiveAgent starting in 2011.

unique_selling_points: Simplicity-first design: Built by support professionals for support professionals, with an intuitive email-like interface that minimizes learning curve and reduces training time.
Best-in-class NPS: Independent research shows Help Scout's Net Promoter Score (NPS) is 7x higher than competitors, reflecting exceptional ease of use and customer satisfaction.
AI-powered efficiency: Built-in AI features (AI Answers, Drafts, Summarize, Assist) are included—not add-ons—helping teams resolve 36% more emails with human oversight.
Transparent, predictable pricing: Per-user pricing with no hidden fees; significant savings (up to 20%) with annual billing; free plan available for small teams without credit card requirement.
Unified omnichannel inbox: Consolidates email, live chat, social media, and messaging in one shared space with collision detection, preventing duplicate responses and enabling seamless collaboration.
Strong customer retention: 80% of customers remain after 4 years, indicating product-market fit and reliability for scaling businesses.
Rapid deployment: 15-day free trial and 3-month free AI Answers trial enable low-risk evaluation; support team answers 99% of emails within 24 hours for implementation help.

founder_information.origin_story: Founded in 2011 by IIT-Kharagpur graduates Niraj and Nitesh, Hiver started as Grexit (Latin for 'flock') with a simple mission: solve the problem of email collaboration for teams. The founders identified a market gap when Gmail was being underutilized for business collaboration. Initially bootstrapped, they achieved significant traction through inbound marketing and product-led growth. In 2016, they secured Series A funding ($4M) from Kalaari Capital and Kae Capital. By 2022, the company raised Series B funding of $22M from K1 Capital and existing investors, accelerating growth and product development.

systems.tagline: Deliver smarter, faster, more personalized service with the world’s #1 AI CRM.
systems.description: Salesforce Service Cloud is an omnichannel customer service platform that centralizes cases, conversations, and knowledge so agents can resolve issues faster across every touchpoint. founder_information.origin_story: Founded in June 2013 in San Francisco by Mathilde Collin and Laurent Perrin, Front was created to solve the problem of customer communication chaos in organizations. Collin, inspired by growing up in a family where 'no one liked their jobs,' aimed to build a platform that transforms the traditional email inbox—designed for individuals—into a collaborative hub for customer-facing teams. The initial product launched in 2014 as a shared inbox for collaborative email management, and the company expanded globally with offices in Paris, Chicago, and Dublin.

statistics.notable_customers: Nordstrom, Crate & Barrel, Ulta Beauty, TUMI, Ralph Lauren, JetBlue/Breeze Airways, Zenni Optical, Tory Burch, Warby Parker and other leading B2C brands.
statistics.market_position: Gladly positions itself as the only CX platform built around customers instead of tickets, with 240M+ conversations powered by Customer AI and hundreds of mid‑market and enterprise brands. It is a multi-time Leader in G2 Help Desk and Contact Center grids, has topped numerous category reports in 2024, and was recognized as “Disruptive Technology of the Year” at the 2025 CCW Excellence Awards.

pricing.model: Subscription pricing primarily per agent (“Hero” / “Superhero” seats) with lower-cost Task User seats, billed per user per month (usually on annual contracts). Telecom usage (voice minutes, SMS) and payment transaction fees are charged separately. Exact current pricing is not fully published; available figures come from third‑party review sites and should be confirmed with Gladly sales.
pricing.billing_period: Monthly pricing, typically billed annually with minimum seat commitments on paid plans.

plans.name: Hero (flagship agent seat)
plans.billing_period: Per user per month, usually billed annually with a minimum number of Hero seats.
plans.agents_included: External sources mention a 10-hero minimum on some Hero packages; actual minimums may vary by contract.
key_features: Full omnichannel agent workspace (voice, email, SMS, chat, social) organized around a single customer conversation instead of tickets.
Native voice and IVR, SMS, web chat, email, Facebook Messenger, Instagram messaging and other digital channels in one interface.
Customer AI and Sidekick capabilities for AI-assisted replies, summaries, intent understanding, and suggested actions.
Built-in knowledge base and Help Center for both agent assistance and customer self-service across channels.
Advanced routing and workforce features (People Match, Skills, agent statuses, proactive outreach).
Real-time and historical analytics (Liveboards, Insight Builder) across agents, channels, and topics.
Access to Gladly integrations and App Platform (Shopify, Magento, BigCommerce, Salesforce, Klaviyo, Slack, loyalty and returns tools, etc.).

plans.name: Superhero (higher-tier Hero package)
plans.billing_period: Per user per month, billed annually with a higher minimum number of seats (e.g., 45 Heroes reported by SMBGuide).
plans.billing_unit: Per named Superhero agent (enhanced Hero seat)
plans.agents_included: External reviews mention a minimum of ~45 Superhero seats; actual thresholds can differ by deal.
key_features: Everything in the Hero plan, typically with enhanced support, strategic guidance, and/or more favorable pricing at scale for larger teams.
Deeper access to advanced AI and automation configuration, routing and reporting tuned for complex, high-volume environments.
Enterprise‑grade onboarding and success resources oriented toward large B2C and global teams.

plans.name: Task User (back-office / limited seat)
plans.billing_period: Per user per month, usually billed annually as an add-on alongside Hero seats.
plans.billing_unit: Per Task User (limited functionality seat, e.g., back‑office and non-contact roles)
plans.agents_included: Offered as an add-on to a core Hero deployment; number of Task Users depends on contract.
key_features: Access to customer context and tasks without full omni-channel handling responsibilities.
Support for back-office workflows that complement front-line Hero agents (e.g., approvals, research, fulfillment follow-up).
Lower-cost seat type helping large organizations extend Gladly access beyond primary contact center agents.

features.name: Unified customer timeline and profiles
features.description: Every interaction across voice, email, SMS, chat, and social is stitched into a single, lifelong conversation per customer so agents always see full history and context without juggling tickets.
available_in_plans: All paid plans (Hero / Superhero; Task Users with limited capabilities)

features.name: Omnichannel, natively built-in channels
features.description: Gladly provides native voice, IVR, SMS, web chat, email, Facebook Messenger, and Instagram Messaging in one interface, allowing customers to switch channels without repeating themselves while agents stay in a single workspace.

features.name: Customer AI and Sidekick
features.description: Customer AI and the Sidekick copilot understand intent, draft and send responses, summarize conversations, and take actions like refunds or order updates so routine work is automated and agents can focus on complex, high-value issues.

features.name: Answers knowledge base and Help Center

features.name: People Match routing and Skills-based distribution
features.description: People Match and Skills route customers to the most appropriate agent based on factors like skills, customer value, wait times and current context, reducing handle times and improving first-contact resolution.

features.name: Liveboards, Insight Builder, and analytics
features.description: Live, customizable dashboards and reporting tools give leaders real-time views of queues, agent activity, topics, and SLAs plus deeper historical analytics to optimize staffing, scripts, and CX strategy.

features.name: App Platform and integrations
features.description: Gladly’s App Platform, REST APIs, and pre-built integrations connect ecommerce, CRM, loyalty, returns, WFM, and survey tools so agents and AI see order data, loyalty status, and shipment details without leaving Gladly.
available_in_plans: All paid plans (Hero / Superhero); integration availability can depend on contract and partner

integrations.api_type: REST APIs over HTTPS with JSON payloads, Lookup API, webhooks, SDKs (e.g., Chat SDK) and an App Platform with OAuth-based apps.
top_integrations: Recharge and subscription/loyalty tools like Smile.io and Yotpo
integrations.api_capabilities: Gladly’s APIs allow managing customer profiles and attributes, reading and writing conversation timelines, accessing channel messages and call transcripts, updating knowledge base content, integrating external systems via Lookup API, streaming event data (e.g., conversation opened/closed) to warehouses via Segment, and building custom apps embedded directly into the agent workspace using the App Platform.

unique_selling_points: Customer-first data model that organizes support around a single lifelong customer conversation instead of tickets or cases, reducing repetition and enabling highly personal experiences.
Native omnichannel contact center with built-in voice, IVR, SMS, chat, email, and social, avoiding the complexity of stitching together multiple vendors for telephony and digital channels.
Customer AI and Sidekick tightly integrated into the core platform, using deep customer context to automate resolutions and assist agents rather than acting as a detached chatbot layer.

Rich ecommerce and retail focus, with deep integrations into platforms like Shopify, Magento/Adobe Commerce, BigCommerce, Loop, and loyalty tools so agents can resolve order, shipping, and return issues end-to-end inside Gladly.

Strong usability and implementation reputation, consistently rated highly on G2 and Capterra for ease of use, time to value, and relationship quality, particularly for mid‑market and enterprise B2C brands.

certifications: GDPR-aligned data protection practices with Data Processing Agreement (DPA) available
security_features: Encryption of data in transit and at rest using industry-standard protocols.
Regular third‑party penetration testing and security audits to identify and remediate vulnerabilities.
SOC 2 Type II–certified infrastructure and processes to ensure security, availability, processing integrity, confidentiality, and privacy.
PCI-DSS–compliant handling of payment card data, including redaction of sensitive details before data is sent to third‑party AI vendors.
Granular access controls and role-based permissions for agents and admins.
Support for Data Subject Requests (access, deletion) and robust data retention controls for customer conversation history.
Auditability and logging of key system events, API access, and administrative changes.
Secure REST APIs with token-based authentication and HTTPS-only endpoints.

founder_information.origin_story: Gladly was founded around 2014–2015 by repeat CX and security entrepreneurs Joseph Ansanelli and Michael Wolfe, who previously worked together at Kana and co‑founded data loss prevention company Vontu. Incubated at Greylock, Gladly was created to reinvent customer service by shifting from fragmented, ticket-based workflows to a single, continuous conversation centered on each customer, anticipating the need to combine scale, intimacy, and AI.

funding_history.total_raised: Approximately 235M USD in total funding across multiple rounds, according to ZoomInfo/Preqin-style data providers.
funding_rounds: Series F-type growth round of 40M USD led by AXA Venture Partners (AVP) announced in September 2024, tied to the launch of Gladly’s unified, AI-powered Customer Service Platform.
Multiple earlier venture rounds backed by firms including Greylock Partners and others, contributing to an aggregated total funding of roughly 235M USD as of 2025.

industries: Marketplaces and platforms with buyer/seller support
best_for: B2C brands with high conversation volumes that need a unified view of customer interactions across voice, chat, SMS, email, and social.
Retailers and ecommerce/DTC companies that want deep order, shipping, and loyalty context in the agent workspace and AI experiences.
Organizations seeking to modernize from legacy ticket-based help desks to a customer- and AI-centric CX platform with strong reporting and automation.
Teams that value agent experience and ease of use, and are willing to invest in a premium CX platform to improve CSAT, efficiency, and revenue from service.
not_ideal_for: Very small teams or early-stage startups with low contact volumes that primarily need a simple, low-cost email/ticketing tool.
Heavily ITSM-focused environments or internal IT help desks requiring deep ITIL workflows rather than B2C customer support.
Organizations unwilling to standardize on a single omnichannel platform or that require strict on-premises deployment.

risk_assessment.contract_flexibility: Pricing is typically quoted via sales with annual contracts and minimum seat counts for Hero/Superhero plans. While add/remove seats is generally possible, there is no widely advertised month-to-month plan, so contract terms should be negotiated carefully.
risk_assessment.data_export: Gladly provides REST APIs, export capabilities, and event streaming (e.g., via Segment) so customer profiles, conversations, and metrics can be extracted into external systems or warehouses. This mitigates lock‑in risk but exporting and reconstructing omnichannel histories into a new platform still requires planning and engineering effort.
common_complaints: Relatively high per-agent pricing compared with entry-level help desks, making it a bigger investment for small teams.
Occasional UI glitches or browser refreshes causing agents to lose what they were typing, as reported in some Capterra reviews.
Desire for more advanced or customizable reporting and Liveboard configurations in certain use cases.
Difficulty seeing, in some channel views, whether a chat visitor has left or replied, leading to uncertainty about when to close a conversation.
A learning curve around certain advanced features (routing, reporting, complex workflows) for new admins.
mitigation: Pilot with a subset of teams and negotiate contract terms (seats, ramp-up schedule, implementation support) to validate ROI before a large-scale rollout.
Use Gladly’s training resources and certification programs (Gladly Academy, admin and routing courses) to ensure admins and agents fully leverage the platform.
Invest early in reporting design using Insight Builder and Liveboards, and consider exporting data to BI tools for advanced analytics needs.
Design clear routing and closure policies, including chat idle rules and proactive follow-up, to reduce uncertainty when customers stop responding.
Leverage the App Platform and APIs to integrate existing CRM, ecommerce, and analytics systems, ensuring data portability and avoiding over-reliance on one vendor for all functions.

The company pioneered CTI (Computer Telephony Integration) technology and was first to market with an all-in-one customer engagement software suite in 1997. Acquired by Alcatel-Lucent in 1999, then by private equity (Permira, TCV) in 2012, and currently led by former Skype CEO Tony Bates (since May 2019).

founder_information.origin_story: Talkdesk was founded in 2011 by Tiago Paiva and Cristina Fonseca, two Portuguese entrepreneurs who met at the University of Porto. Frustrated with the limitations of traditional call center technology—which was expensive, inflexible, and difficult to use—they built a prototype in their dorm room and tested it with early customers. The positive feedback led them to move to the United States in 2012, where they secured seed funding and expanded their platform into the market-leading cloud contact center solution.

unique_selling_points: Native SAP S/4HANA Integration: Unmatched deep integration with SAP's business systems provides true 360-degree customer view including real-time order, billing, inventory, and supply chain data directly within the service workspace—a capability competitors can only approximate with connectors.

Joule AI Copilot for Customer Service: Embedded generative AI delivering contextualized, natural-language assistance across all service tasks, with integration into broader SAP AI strategy and exclusive access to SAP's business context and knowledge graph.

Composable Cloud-Native Architecture: Microservices-based, API-first platform running on hyperscaler infrastructure enabling rapid customization with low-code/no-code tools via SAP Build, ensuring future-proof scalability without vendor lock-in concerns.

Enterprise-Grade Security and Compliance: Built-in ISO/IEC 27001, SOC 2 Type II, GDPR, and industry-specific compliance certifications with dedicated data residency options—essential for regulated industries and global enterprises.

Service-to-Cash Automation: Unique capability to automate entire service lifecycle from first contact through field resolution to invoicing and revenue recognition through seamless SAP ecosystem integration, reducing manual work and errors.

founder_information.origin_story: SAP (Systems, Applications, and Products in Data Processing) was founded on April 1, 1972, by five former IBM employees with a vision to create standardized enterprise software for real-time data processing. SAP Service Cloud emerged as part of SAP's evolution into cloud-based CX solutions, officially launching as a key component of the SAP Cloud for Customer (now SAP Customer Experience) portfolio in the early 2010s.

Tomas Gorny, a Polish-born entrepreneur, previously founded IPOWER (which sold for nearly $1B to Warburg/Goldman Sachs in 2011 and went public) and SiteLock. Nextiva has grown to become the largest privately held business communications provider in the U.S., serving 100,000+ businesses and handling billions of interactions annually.

features.description: Provides rules, workflows and automated routing to assign tickets, set priorities, send notifications and trigger follow-ups, reducing manual work and ensuring consistent SLA handling.

features.name: Knowledge base and self-service
features.description: Lets teams publish branded FAQ and documentation portals with folders, categories and articles so customers can quickly find answers and reduce repetitive ticket volume.
available_in_plans: Pro (with limits on articles, folders and categories)

features.name: Reports and analytics
features.description: Offers reports and dashboards to track ticket volume, response times, agent activity and customer feedback, enabling managers to monitor performance and optimize support operations.

features.name: Apps, integrations and marketplace
features.description: Includes a catalog of apps and connectors for ecommerce, CMS, communication tools and utilities so businesses can plug UVdesk into their existing stack and extend capabilities as needed.

features.name: Team collaboration tools
features.description: Provides agent activity tracking, internal notes, saved replies and task management features so teams can collaborate on tickets, share context and maintain consistent responses.

integrations.api_type: REST API using standard HTTP methods (GET, POST, PATCH/UPDATE, DELETE)
top_integrations: Google Drive, OneDrive, Box, Dropbox (file storage apps)
integrations.api_capabilities: The REST API supports creating and updating tickets, adding replies and threads, fetching ticket lists and details, managing users and agents, and integrating external systems with UVdesk’s ticketing and workflow engine.

unique_selling_points: Strong focus on ecommerce and marketplace support, with deep integrations into platforms like Magento, Shopify, OpenCart, CS-Cart and marketplaces such as Amazon and eBay to bring order data directly into tickets.
Dual offering of a free, fully open-source helpdesk (self-hosted) and a managed cloud SaaS version built on Symfony and PHP, giving businesses flexibility in deployment and customization.
Rich modular app ecosystem that lets users extend UVdesk with integrations, automation modules and reports tailored to their particular ecommerce stack and workflows.
Advanced branding and customization options for the knowledge base and support portal, allowing teams to align self-service experiences closely with their storefront’s look and feel.

Competitive pricing for SMBs and mid-market teams compared to many generalist helpdesks, while still covering core features like ticketing, workflows, reporting, knowledge base and multi-channel support.
target_audience: Small and midsize ecommerce businesses
Online retailers running on Magento, Shopify, OpenCart, CS-Cart, WooCommerce and similar platforms
Marketplaces and multi-vendor stores that need order-aware helpdesk workflows
Agencies and developers seeking an open-source, PHP/Symfony-based helpdesk to customize for clients
SMBs looking for a lower-cost, ecommerce-focused alternative to large enterprise helpdesks

reputation.g2_rating_details: Users on G2 highlight UVdesk’s comprehensive toolkit (ticketing, workflows, form builder, knowledge base, reporting and agent management) and lower cost versus many competitors, while commonly requesting improvements to the knowledge base UI.
awards: Positively rated as an ecommerce-focused open-source helpdesk option in multiple software comparison guides

security_features: Role-based access control for agents and admin users
Secure API access tokens for integrating external systems
Spam and email filtering controls on mailboxes
HTTPS support for hosted deployments and recommended for self-hosting
Data isolation via separate self-hosted instances or dedicated SaaS accounts
